thread.title: Steve Spurrier 'planning' to appear on College GameDay Saturday
thread.title_full: Steve Spurrier 'planning' to appear on College GameDay Saturday | AL.com

author: Creg Stephenson | cstephenson@al.com
title: Steve Spurrier 'planning' to appear on College GameDay Saturday
text:
Steve Spurrier has apparently made good on his assertion that he is not necessarily done with college football.
Spurrier, who stepped down as South Carolina head coach on Tuesday, said on "The Dan Patrick Show" Wednesday morning that he is scheduled to appear on ESPN's College GameDay broadcast on Saturday. GameDay will originate from Ann Arbor, Mich., where Michigan is set to take on Michigan State in a battle of highly ranked Big Ten contenders.
"Rece Davis has asked me to be on GameDay up in Ann Arbor, Michigan, for the Michigan-Michigan State game," Spurrier said. "Right now I'm planning on going. I've never been to the Big House in Ann Arbor. That's one reason I'm going, because it's a new adventure. I'd love to see that big stadium up there."
Patrick then asked if Spurrier had considered a television analyst career full-time.
"Oh, I don't know, Dan," Spurrier said. "I'm just not sure. I do want to do something, though. I'm not going to sit around and try to be a real good golfer. I am going to play some golf, but I'm smart enough to know that my best golf days are a little bit behind me."
Spurrier, 70, went 86-49 in 10-plus seasons at South Carolina, including 2-4 this year. Overall, in 26 seasons at Duke, Florida and South Carolina, he was 228-89-2, including seven conference titles and the 1996 national championship.
